meanings.definition: A person who performs menial tasks or runs errands for someone else.
meanings.sent1: The flunkies at the office help with filing and making coffee.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman had a team of flunkies to attend to his every need.
meanings.sent3: The flunkies in the movie were always comically messing up the tasks given to them.
meanings.sent4: She treated her assistants like flunkies, expecting them to do everything for her.
meanings.sent5: The flunkies scurried around the mansion, trying to keep up with their boss's demands.

meanings.definition: To fail a test or course due to poor performance.
meanings.sent1: If you don't study, you might flunkies the exam.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't flunkies my math test tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: He managed to flunkies every single quiz this semester, which was quite impressive in a way.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was about to flunkies out of school, but then she started studying harder.
meanings.sent5: The thought of flunkies the final exam made her study late into the night.
